function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited sensor diversity in IBEM may lead to incomplete monitoring of IEQ parameters and potential health risks.","Impact":"Incomplete monitoring may result in undetected air quality issues, leading to health problems for building occupants.","Mitigation":"Expand sensor capabilities to include a wider range of air quality parameters and environmental factors for comprehensive IEQ monitoring.","Technologies":"Advanced sensor technologies for accurate and real-time monitoring of air quality, acoustics, and additional environmental parameters.","People":"Building occupants, especially those sensitive to air quality and environmental conditions.","Owner":"Building managers, facility maintenance personnel"},{"Description":"Lack of sensor customization and flexibility in IBEM limits its adaptability to different IEQ monitoring scenarios.","Impact":"Inflexible sensor functions may lead to inaccurate or inadequate monitoring of specific environmental conditions in different built environments, compromising occupant health and comfort.","Mitigation":"Develop customizable sensor modules or interface options to adapt to diverse built environment scenarios and specific IEQ monitoring requirements.","Technologies":"Modular sensor design, adaptive interface technology, and IoT-based sensor integration for customizable and flexible IEQ monitoring solutions.","People":"Building engineers, environmental consultants, and IEQ specialists.","Owner":"Technology developers, building management companies, research institutions"},{"Description":"Limited data flow and feedback interaction in IBEM may hinder real-time adjustment of environmental parameters based on occupants' needs and preferences.","Impact":"Inadequate feedback loop may lead to suboptimal environmental conditions, affecting occupant satisfaction, health, and energy consumption.","Mitigation":"Implement a bidirectional data flow system that enables real-time interaction between building occupants and environmental control systems for responsive and adaptive IEQ management.","Technologies":"IoT-enabled feedback mechanisms, occupant-centric data analytics, and smart building automation systems for personalized IEQ control.","People":"Building occupants, facility managers, and energy efficiency experts.","Owner":"Smart building technology providers, facility management companies, and environmental control system manufacturers"}]}
